LGBT is an acronym that stands for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender. Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual addresses the sexual orientation of an individual. Transgender addresses gender identity and gender expression of an individual. For more information on sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, please refer to our LGBT Portal: https://in.accenture.com/inclusionanddiversity/lgbt/be-informed/
INCLDIV1

category.pattern: *DOES ACCENTURE PROVIDE COVERAGE FOR GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY*
category.template:
Accenture medical insurance also includes gender reassignment surgery. This is part of overall medical cover you are eligible for and is not over and above the same. 100% cover amount can be availed. INR 3 lakh for career level 8-13 and INR 5 lakh for career level 7 and above. Same co-pay percentages will be applied.
INCLDIV2

According to the new Rights of Persons with Disability Act 2016 “Person with disability” means a person with long term physical, mental, intellectual or sensory impairment which, in interaction with barriers, hinders his full and effective participation in society equally with others. The types of Disabilities covered by Accenture are listed in Allsec.
INCLDIV3

Any assistance or changes to a position in the workplace or technology add-ons that will enable an employee to do his or her job despite having a disability is considered as Reasonable Accommodation. This includes Transportation (daily commute), Workplace Adjustments (workstation, footstool, etc.) and Assistive Technologies (Software and hardware devices). The following Reasonable Accommodation are provided to Accenture employees who have declared their disability:
1.Emergency Preparedness: The emergency evacuation team will be in the best position to plan for your safety if your details, disability status and limitations are known.
2.Tax and Statutory Benefit: There is a tax benefit on transportation allowance of INR 3,200/- per month and ESI benefit for employees who are Persons with Disabilities and are drawing a salary income upto INR 25,000/- under statutory benefit.
3.Reasonable Accommodations: Employees can avail the following Reasonable Accommodations: a. Transportation/Medical Cabs - Daily commute through medical cabs meant for employees with Vision and Orthopedic Impairment – Speak to your people advisor to avail this facility.
b. Workplace Adjustments - Workstation adjustments, restroom modifications, footstools, etc.
c. Assistive Technologies - Software and Hardware devices
Employees can raise a Workplace adjustment or Assistive Technology device request in the following link: https://ts.accenture.com/sites/PwD_Reasonable_Accommodations/default.aspx
4.PwD Mentoring Program: Mentoring program is designed to provide opportunity to be a guide, coach and champion for persons with disabilities. The program leaves our employees inspired by the life’s journey of our employees who are Persons with Disabilities. It also helps one understand the unique challenges facing persons with disabilities. For mentees, the program intends to provide access to coaching, information and access to leadership within Accenture – for additional perspectives and holistic development. Over 45 countries participate in the PwD mentoring program.
5.Other Career Development Programs: The career path framework developed for employees who are Persons with Disabilities identifies the eligible employees at various career levels for the career development programs.
INCLDIV4

*WHAT ACTIVITIES ARE WE DOING INTERNALLY AT ACCENTURE IN INDIA TO CREATE AN INCLUSIVE ENVIRONMENT FOR LGBT EMPLOYEES*
category.template:
Ensuring an inclusive environment for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) employees across the globe is a key and integral part of Accenture's Global Inclusion and Diversity strategy. We are committed to raising awareness and educating all Accenture people about our LGBT community, while simultaneously supporting our LGBT employees and providing a workplace of equality. Here are some of Pride at Accenture in India programs and initiatives to re-iterate our commitment:
1.Hues of the Rainbow: This is a series of sessions with LGBT Community members across geographies at Accenture where they have voluntarily stepped up to share their journey line with us. Subscribe to the Hues of the Rainbow channel and watch the recording of previous sessions by clicking here: https://mediaexchange.accenture.com/channel/Hues%2Bof%2Bthe%2BRainbow/67962551
2.Be an LGBT Ally: Having informed, visible and vocal Allies is key in overcoming challenges and creating an inclusive environment, which inspires collaboration every day. An Ally is someone who takes action to promote lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender inclusion regardless of their sexual orientation or gender identity and expression. Sign up as an ally https://people.accenture.com/flairs/assign/5388086064b8cbf84b004b34 and demonstrate your commitment to an inclusive workplace for all of their sexual orientation and gender identity.
3.LGBT Ally Network Council aka LANC: LANC is an initiative taken by Accenture in India to enable allies in the country to drive LGBT Inclusion awareness across locations. The council consists of:
a. The India GU Committee which sets the directions to integrate LGBT Network efforts with Inclusion and Diversity priorities.
b. Location leads will translate the priorities into programs on the ground and act as pulse of the LGBT network.
c. Action Force Members will actively engage, support the location leads in executing the on-ground initiatives/programs and drive participation for the LGBT events hosted in their respective location.
Should you want to volunteer as LANC Action force member and drive pride activities at your location, please write to us India_TalentStrategy@accenture.com; Subject of the email should be I want to Volunteer as Action Force Member for LANC.
4.LGBT Mentoring Program: Accenture’s LGBT Mentoring Program https://in.accenture.com/inclusionanddiversity/lgbt/global-mentoring-program/ enables LGBT employees and others who have an interest in LGBT to connect with experienced colleagues and promote knowledge-sharing between mentors and mentees. The program provides access to coaching, information and leadership for additional perspectives and holistic development. Participants may or may not be members of the LGBT community but a connection is made based on a common interest in the LGBT topic.
Sign up to become an LGBT Mentor / Mentee. https://people.accenture.com/MyProfile
5.Pride Month Celebration: We celebrate Pride month internally at Accenture every year in month of June. The celebration is marked with flurry of colorful activities like pride wall across Accenture locations, network activities and leadership engagement. These activities are driven by our allies’ network.
INCLDIV5
